qas.question: What component is added to bitumen to improve it?
To what other paving material is Selenizza added?
What purpose does Selenizza have in the drilling industry?
In what form is Selenizza offered?
What is mostly used as an additive in constructing recycling rings?
What is available in powder or fluid form and offered in various particle sizes?
What is Selenizza mixed with to improve resistance to bridges?
What is Selenizza mixed with to worsen viscoelastic properties?
What may be mixed with cold bitumen in tanks?

context: <a0_0><b5_0><b9_0>Selenizza<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> is mainly used as an additive in the road construction sector. It is mixed with traditional <b7_0><b8_0>bitumen<b8_0/><b7_0/> to improve both the viscoelastic properties and the resistance to ageing. It may be blended with the hot bitumen in tanks, but its <a3_0>granular<a3_0/> form allows it to be fed in the mixer or in the recycling ring of normal asphalt plants. Other typical applications include the production of <a1_0>mastic asphalts<a1_0/> for sidewalks, bridges, car-parks and urban roads as well as drilling <a2_0>fluid additives<a2_0/> for the oil and gas industry. <b6_0>Selenizza<b6_0/> is available in powder or in granular material of various particle sizes and is packaged in big <a4_0>bags<a4_0/> or in thermal fusible polyethylene bags.
